intro: Camassia scilloides f. candida, commonly known as the white camas, is a striking perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs in early to mid-summer, adding vibrant color to the landscape. The white form of this species is distinguished by its pale or white flowers, making it a unique and ornamental addition to gardens.
